Record Class FontData

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.dua3.utility.text.FontData
Record Components:
families - the list of font family names; it is always guaranteed to contain at least one entry with the family name at index 0 and alternative names following
size - the font size in points
monospaced - if the font is monospaced
bold - whether the font style is bold
italic - whether the font style is italicized
underline - whether the font style includes an underline
strikeThrough - whether the font style includes a strike-through
fontDef - the FontDef object defining extended font properties
fontspec - the font specification string without color information
cssStyle - the CSS representation of the font's style
ascent - the distance above the baseline for the highest ascender
descent - the distance below the baseline for the lowest descender
height - the overall height of the font, including ascent and descent
spaceWidth - the width of the space character in the font
public record FontData(List<String> families, float size, boolean monospaced, boolean bold, boolean italic, boolean underline, boolean strikeThrough, FontDef fontDef, String fontspec, String cssStyle, double ascent, double descent, double height, double spaceWidth) extends Record
Represents font data, containing attributes and metrics for a specific font style.

    • FontData

      public FontData(List<String> families, float size, boolean monospaced, boolean bold, boolean italic, boolean underline, boolean strikeThrough, FontDef fontDef, String fontspec, String cssStyle, double ascent, double descent, double height, double spaceWidth)
      Canonical record constructor..
      Parameters:
      families - the list of font family names; it is always guaranteed to contain at least one entry with the family name at index 0 and alternative names following
      size - the font size in points
      monospaced - if the font is monospaced
      bold - whether the font style is bold
      italic - whether the font style is italicized
      underline - whether the font style includes an underline
      strikeThrough - whether the font style includes a strike-through
      fontDef - the FontDef object defining extended font properties
      fontspec - the font specification string without color information
      cssStyle - the CSS representation of the font's style
      ascent - the distance above the baseline for the highest ascender
      descent - the distance below the baseline for the lowest descender
      height - the overall height of the font, including ascent and descent
      spaceWidth - the width of the space character in the font

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static FontData get(String family, float size, boolean monospaced, boolean bold, boolean italic, boolean underline, boolean strikeThrough, double ascent, double descent, double height, double spaceWidth)
      Creates and returns a new instance of FontData with the specified attributes and metrics.
      Parameters:
      family - the list of font family names; must not be empty
      size - the font size; must be non-negative
      monospaced - whether the font is monospaced
      bold - whether the font is bold
      italic - whether the font is italic
      underline - whether the font is underlined
      strikeThrough - whether the font is strike-through
      ascent - the ascent metric of the font; must be non-negative
      descent - the descent metric of the font; must be non-negative
      height - the total height of the font; must be greater than or equal to ascent
      spaceWidth - the width of the space character; must be positive
      Returns:
      a new instance of FontData containing the specified attributes and metrics

    • get

      public static FontData get(SequencedCollection<String> families, float size, boolean monospaced, boolean bold, boolean italic, boolean underline, boolean strikeThrough, double ascent, double descent, double height, double spaceWidth)
      Creates and returns a new instance of FontData with the specified attributes and metrics.
      Parameters:
      families - the list of font family names; must not be empty
      size - the font size; must be non-negative
      monospaced - if the font is monospaced
      bold - whether the font is bold
      italic - whether the font is italic
      underline - whether the font is underlined
      strikeThrough - whether the font is strike-through
      ascent - the ascent metric of the font; must be non-negative
      descent - the descent metric of the font; must be non-negative
      height - the total height of the font; must be greater than or equal to ascent
      spaceWidth - the width of the space character; must be positive
      Returns:
      a new instance of FontData containing the specified attributes and metrics

    • descentSigned

      public double descentSigned()
      Returns the negative value of the descent attribute for the font.
      Returns:
      the signed descent, which is the negative value of the descent.

    • similar

      public static boolean similar(FontData a, FontData b)
      Test if two fonts are similar. This method is provided to be used when inheriting fonts because equals also tests both instances to be of the exact same class.
      Parameters:
      a - the first font
      b - the second font
      Returns:
      true, if a and b have the same attributes

    • delta

      public static FontDef delta(@Nullable FontData f1, @Nullable FontData f2)
      Determine differences between two fonts.
      Parameters:
      f1 - the first font
      f2 - the second font
      Returns:
      a FontDef instance that defines the changed values

    • fontDef

      public FontDef fontDef()
      Get a copy of this FontData instance's FontDef.

      FontData is immutable, but the contained FontDef is not. By returning a copy, we can assert that this object's state will not change.

      Returns:
      copy of this FontData instance's FontDef member

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this record class. The representation contains the name of the class, followed by the name and value of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      toString in class Record
      Returns:
      a string representation of this object

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. Reference components are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object); primitive components are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
